column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for only a few days and so far I really like it. I take 10 mg in the morning and another 10 mg at lunch time. I was on Methylin for years taking 20 mg twice a day and I had bad anxiety and I was irritable but I could concentrate. The doctors switched me to dextrostat and I can concentrate, complete tasks, and not become overwhelmed with multiple things in front of me to complete. I don't have the anxiety or irritation and I seem to be in a better mood throughout the day compared to when I was on Methylin.

column1: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
column2: on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
john211@aol.com, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
W, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I took this drug twice in my life.  Once in high school, but I discontinued it because it made my arms shake.  I take it now, 14 years later, and I really like the obvious results. It is a bit difficult to remember to take it as often as I should.  Also, I tend to forget to eat, when I'm on it.  I learned early not to drink soda with it, as my heart beat felt too fast.My short term memory is much better when on this medication. I forget less words and pay attention to conversations better. I feel motivated to accomplish many things. That last one was why I wanted to treat my ADHD again.  I found I wasn't doing anything.  I thought it was my personality, lazy, until I researched the disorder again, for my son's ADHD.

column9: This med has really changed my life  .What my life would of been like when i was little and my grades if tey knew more about ADHA  ? But we can not look back ,but we can make up for some of those day ,there is so much to tell about his drug ,i would take up so much space ,i will just say if you are on this site and are wondering about this drug , wonder no more it is a life changer i highly recommend it.........

column2: peewee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: it helps me to focus. also may be curving my appetite.

column2: davidb, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have found it a great drug.  My problem is I forget to take it every several hours.  I take it along side prozac for depression.   If I take too much I get sleepy. It is not good to drink alot of coffee.   There are times when I go off back to typical add behavior .   Taking  this drug has spared me alot of pain of add.  They make you feel like a criminal at the drug store since it is considered a class A narcotic.

column1: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
column2: Jewelia, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking DEXTROSTAT for the past 8 years and I really don't know how I would have functioned without it.   It truely gave me my life back.  Now, Shire discontinued making the Brand Dextrostat and the Generic made by BARR is not even close to the same thing.  Not only does it not work, it makes me anxious and really raises my blood pressure.  So, I have these awful side effects on top of sleeping all day.  It really is not worth it and I am afraid I will have to stop taking it and go back to having no life at all.  I am angry that the FDA has let this happen.  A Generic should be EXACTLY the same medication, with the EXACTLY the same ingredients!!!  Please, if you have the same problem, report it to the FDA so something can be done about it!!!  This is too important!  Thanks.

column2: AmberD, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medicaation has made a big differance in my life. I believe ADD/ADHD is under diagnosed in adults that were not diagnosed as children. All my life I have had to live by making myself notes for everything from Dr's appts to what room I was goingto clean the nest day. I donthave to make notes for my life anymore when taking this medication. I think I am on to low of a dose though. Does anyone know what the proper dose of this medication is?Thanks, Ambe

column2: amanda100granny, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: When Dextrostat got to where it was not working as good for me, my Doctor would not allow me to take stronger.  It was being taken for Chronic Fatigue.  I could do most of my work at home which we have several businesses being run from my home.  He claimed too, they are taking brand name Dextrostat off the market and you can only get generic.  He did then claim to raise the mg. to 15 mg. from 10 mg.  It is a brown and clear capsule and it did curb my appetite, but left me so weak, I could take one to go to sleep.    I sure would like to know if it is truly what he said it was.  I do know, I am going to have to go to a different Doctor just to try and find something that will work.  I am going to have to baby sit this weekend and it is impossible for me to take care of myself, much less two small children.  I am 62 yrs. old.  I was on Dextrostat 10 mg. for about 10 years.  Maybe even longer.  My Doctor left town this whole week and I cannot get anything called out and it has left me in such a bind.  I sure wish you guys could help me!  I know that is impossible, as this is just a survey.  The brand name was a yellow tablet and that is the one that worked for me.  When he switched over to generic, it only made me sleep.  Are they truly taking this off the market?(Brand Name?)

column2: ronzumie, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: it has been used by me for the past 10 years, it is the only medication that helps my major depression, anxiety, and add. i am disabled and had to retire at age 50, iam 58 now. before i started this medication i was bedridden for 2 years, and given every medication known to treat depression, finally after almost dying from the reaction from a mao inhibator. then with the introduction of dexidrine,15 mgs 3xs a day my life started to improve almost imediatley. i was no longer bedridden, i met my wife in church, i started to live again, no more suicide attempts, and i began to enjoy life. i have had problems ever since childhood. i am trully lessed that my doctor saw fit to give me this treatment. thanks for hearing me out        sincerly ron

column2: gonenorth, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Excellent experience.  I experimented with dosage and found a very low dose once in the morning kept me from eating disorders and sleep loss.  For me 5mg a morning made a life altering change for the better.  However due to high blood pressure and heart they took me off six months ago.  Now I'm 50 pounds overweight still have high blood pressure and am contantly depressed and definately living a poor quality life.  The weight and inactivity itself will prob due me in at the end.  When will doctors wake up.

column2: ADDICT, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: to all parents be careful with drugs like these because i finally got out of their grip I abused this drug and others just like it for the past 10 years with no help from my doctor because i met with him for 5 minutes once every 6 months or so not knowing the dangers til i was 17 and by that time i had been addicted for 3 years no one told me they could kill me just that they were helping me so i just took them by the time i found out it was to late i had become such a good liar with them no one questioned me so here i am 10 plus years later with nothing to show but rotted teeth 1 heart attack and a large majority or my brain fried from countless nights of lack of sleep   Im not bitter about any of this it was my addiction i only blame two people my initial doctor that told me these drugs where completely safe and non-addictive (im not kidding he said that) and myself for thinking i could control this because it was a prescription drug that i only was allowed so many of once a month PARENTS PLEASE MONITOR YOUR CHILDREN WITH THESE TYPES OF DRUGS THEY ARE SAFE IF YOU KNOW ALL THE FACTS I DONT KNOW HOW MUCH PAIN IVE COST BUT IF THIS HELPS JUST ONE PERSON I WILL FEEL BETTER ABOUT MY PURPOSE IN LIFE SO PLEASE BE CAREFUL PLEASE

column2: Ang, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medication for years for the treatment of ADHD and find it keeps my symptoms well under control. Symptoms such as inattentiveness, poor short term memory, inability to follow through with simple tasks.

column2: Dinerdeentn@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: After fighting depression for 38 years, I was diagnosed with ADHD, put on a lot of diffent meds. Dextrostat-- Dexedrine along with an antidepression med,  changed my life.. However I have heart problems and the Dr's are wanting to take me off the amphetamines, but, I wont have  the mental quality of life I have had in the past 5-6 years and I   do not want to go back into depression..  Between a heart attack and Depression...  I'd rather bite the dust than to spend one day in the depths of depression!!!!!!!!!
